name: Kelowna Inn & Suites

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Kelowna Motor Inn on several occasions, and all of these times have a had a good expereiance. Its not the Fairmont so dont expect world class rooms, but the rooms they have are always clean, well appointed, and the maid service is very good as well. For the price you will pay, you cant get a better value anywhere. The location is also great, you can easily walk to downtown for dinner or to go to a beach. I recomend staying here for sure!
reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but Clean and Great Service!

likes.liked: — Great Front Desk Staff, Clean rooms,great location!

reviews.title: Not very impressed
reviews.text: We had to go to Kelowna for some business in early June and decided to try the Kelowna Motor Inn based on some reviews on trip advisor. I knew from the reviews that it was not a high end hotel but it was rated #8 and it sounded like they were very big on customer service and cleanliness. Nothing could have been further from the truth in our experience.

reviews.title: Great for families
reviews.text: The first night I phoned the lobby at 9 pm to ask for an extra pillow and was told by an employee named Andrew rather rudely that he was too busy to look (it was a monday night) and hung up on me. The room wasn't that great either for being recently renovated.

The sink was chipped in serveral places and the tap leaked. We checked out the next day and planned to return later in the week to finish our business. When we returned I asked for a different room and this one was even worse. Once again the sink was very chipped, there was a big stain on the carpet and an odd smell in the room. The next day I noticed the sheet had a large hole in it and the blanket had a suspicous stain on it and asked the cleaning lady, who was working a few doors down to please replace it when she was cleaning our room. We then left for the day and returned around 6 pm. We arrived to find the " Please Make Up Room " sign lying on the ground outside the door and the room unmade. When I complained I was told the sign said "Do Not Disturb" and she had left. As there were very few hotel guests at that time and I had told her my room number and left the "Please Make Up Room" sign hanging on the door I was rather perplexed by the situation. What really made matters worse was when Andrew arrived at our door with clean towels and a clean blanket and had the same rude attitude as he had the first night on the phone ( this blanket by the way was full of patched holes). Even my husband noticed his attitude and he is usually very tolerant. All these compaints may seem minor but coupled with rudeness it left us with a very unpleasant stay at this hotel. My final conclusion is that this is a very poorly run hotel and this will be our last visit.
reviews.title: Good value for money in a pricey town
Great value and location in Kelowna
reviews.text: We stayed at the Kelowna Motor Inn in January on our way to the snow. The loft room we chose was a great layout for a family (of 5) with 2 queen beds on the ground level and another queen bed upstairs. It was very modern and clean, the kitchenette was quite well equipped although no oven, and it was very spacious. There was a bit of a noise problem with the upstairs being mezzanine style but not too bad. The indoor pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. I would recommend this for anyone wanting reasonably priced accommodation.

This place was nice, up to date furnishings, clean and quite comfortable. The location is relatively close to downtown. The staff is very helpful and the internet terminal in the lobby is a nice touch. My only complaint is that the $130 I paid for a 1 Queen bed room was a bit excessive for a motel.
reviews.title: Decent place, but overpriced.

likes.liked: — It was quite confortable, the AC was running before I got to the room
likes.disliked: — The price. I paid more than the average, I think it was raised for the long weekend.

reviews.text: For the price it is a good deal/value. There are no luxuries, it is a nice, clean basic hotel. 4 of us stayed in a 3 Queen loft and had more than enough room. The suite also had a small kitchenette which was perfect for breakfasts and snacks and it did have a fridge for keeping beverages cold which was awesome. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again. The area was not the best but it was walking distance to downtown which is a bonus. Also, the one side of the hotel faced a busy street (Harvey Ave), the other side was much quietier if that's important to you.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because we had stayed there in the past (15 years ago) and it was great then. Now its not so great.
reviews.title: Probobly wont stay there again

reviews.text: 1.We requested a non-smoking/non pet room as one of the children we had with us was asthmatic. The room stank of cigarette smoke. The room that was right beside ours was a smoking room and because they were in a corner under the stairs there was no ventilation whatsoever,every time you would open the door the smell was awful. It was so bad in our room that the child with asthma had a horrible night as did we as she was up several times. Thank goodness we were only there one night. The hotel was packed being summer and no place else really to go.
reviews.title: Very Nice place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2.As well we requested a kitchenette so we could make this night affordable. The kitchen is so poorly stocked with pots & pans/utensils its almost impossible to cook in it. For example:there were six of us and one 8 inch frying pan to cook bacon eggs and hashbrowns in.
reviews.title: Interesting place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights and it was an awesome deal for what we paid ($75/night). I've stayed in hundreds of motels in my life and most are plain, cold, sterile and bare-bones... The room we had here was none of those things. The walls were a warm cream color and the door to the room was kind of a french door. We were on the second floor and our room had a table and chairs outside of it. This was the smoking area, which was pretty handy for us, but might be a nuissance to others. The motor inn is about a 15 minute walk to downtown Kelowna.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!!

reviews.text: The TV in our room was a nice new-ish flatscreen 32 inches (I think). I only went swimming once but the pool was nice. The ice machine is in its own little room so it doesn't make noise in the middle of the night. There was coin laundry and free internet access in the lobby, 24-7. The coffee was good (Wolfgang Puck). The staff were friendly and helpful and there are loads of free maps and brochures in the lobby. I would NOT recommend the Chinese food next door however.
reviews.title: had a great stay
Very nice....
reviews.text: All in all I LOVE this little motel and me and my partner have vowed to stay here the next time we're in town.
Our stay was pleasant here. Our first time to Kelowna and the staff made us feel welcome and provided us with lots of information on what to do and how to get there.
reviews.title: frustrated

likes.disliked: — indifferent/difficult day manager I attempted to discuss our problems with during checkout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and nicely appointed. Didn't get to try the pool, but it looked nice too.
reviews.title: OK Place to Stay

reviews.text: We got a fantastic group rate for our weekend in Kelowna. The rooms were a bit small, but beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The pool and hottub were great as well. Having lived in Kelowna for many years previously, I know that the Mekong Restaraunt on site is excellent- it was my favorite when I lived there. Great hotel in a central location to downtown or the Orchard Plaza mall.
reviews.title: Great Group rate

reviews.text: Very reasonable price. I was concerned that for the price, it would not be so wonderful, but I was only passing through for one day. It is perhaps the nicest motel style place I have stayed. This is a price performer. Clean, neat, great service at the front desk. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great value for the price

reviews.text: We found the Kelowna Inn & Suites to be the best value for a road trip for my cousin from Germany. We were staying for two nights, so cleanliness and location was key. This allowed us to save the funds for tours and dinners. We were happy to have wi-fi access to plan the rest of the trip and to get maps. The front desk staff were very personable and assisted us with locating a dentist for my cousin. Although the days were full for us, it was interesting to see a hot tub in this type of hotel.
reviews.title: After the Wine Festival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gear people, great town, great location and an all-in-all great experience
reviews.title: Great Value & Very Friendly

reviews.text: It was very refreshing to have such a clean room, friendly staff and great ammenities for such a low price. We were greeted by a very nice lady at the front desk who was good humored and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great room & value

description: The Kelowna Inn & Suites is independent by choice; to serve you better. Whether upgrading linens and duvets, installing LCD televisions, or offering a free continental breakfast, you are central to every decision we make. Our staff are flexible and responsive, our guest rooms fresh and inviting, our bedding crisp and bright, our amenities soothing and our property inviting. Stay with us and discover that the Kelowna Inn & Suites is more than your average chain hotel.
